title: Dubai, United Arab Emirates
description: Experience the glamour and modernity of Dubai, known for its skyscrapers, luxury shopping, and desert adventures.

feats.title: Burj Khalifa
feats.description: Visit the iconic Burj Khalifa, the world's tallest building, and enjoy stunning views from its observation decks.

feats.title: Dubai Mall
feats.description: Indulge in luxury shopping and entertainment at the vast Dubai Mall, home to numerous international brands and attractions.

feats.title: Desert Safari
feats.description: Embark on a thrilling desert safari to experience sand dunes, camel rides, and traditional Bedouin-style camps.

feats.title: Palm Jumeirah
feats.description: Relax on the artificial island of Palm Jumeirah and enjoy its upscale resorts and beautiful beaches.

feats.title: Dubai Creek
feats.description: Take a traditional abra boat ride along Dubai Creek, a historic waterway that showcases the city's heritage.

faq.title: Best time to visit
faq.description: The best time to visit Dubai is during the cooler months from November to March.

faq.title: Language
faq.description: Arabic is the official language, but English is widely spoken, especially in tourist areas.

faq.title: Currency
faq.description: The currency used in Dubai is the UAE Dirham (AED).

faq.title: Transportation
faq.description: Dubai has an efficient public transportation system, including the Dubai Metro and buses.

faq.title: Local Cuisine
faq.description: Try delicious Arabic dishes such as shawarma, falafel, and hummus.

title: Cairo, Egypt
description: Discover the ancient city of Cairo, Egypt's capital, with its historic landmarks and rich cultural heritage.

feats.title: Giza Pyramids
feats.description: Marvel at the majestic Giza Pyramids, including the Great Pyramid of Khufu, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

feats.title: Egyptian Museum
feats.description: Explore the Egyptian Museum in Tahrir Square, home to an extensive collection of ancient artifacts and treasures.

feats.title: Khan El-Khalili
feats.description: Shop for traditional souvenirs and immerse yourself in the bustling atmosphere of Khan El-Khalili, Cairo's famous bazaar.

feats.title: Islamic Cairo
feats.description: Discover the historic mosques, madrasas, and winding streets of Islamic Cairo, reflecting Egypt's Islamic heritage.

feats.title: Nile River Cruise
feats.description: Take a leisurely cruise on the Nile River to witness the city's landmarks from the water.

faq.title: Best time to visit
faq.description: The best time to visit Cairo is during the cooler months from October to April.

faq.title: Language
faq.description: Arabic is the official language, and English is widely understood, especially in tourist areas.

faq.title: Currency
faq.description: The currency used in Egypt is the Egyptian Pound (EGP).

faq.title: Transportation
faq.description: Cairo has various transportation options, including taxis, buses, and the Cairo Metro.

faq.title: Safety
faq.description: Exercise caution and stay updated on travel advisories, especially in certain areas.

title: Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
description: Discover the modern capital of Saudi Arabia, Riyadh, with its towering skyscrapers, traditional souks, and cultural attractions.

feats.title: Kingdom Centre Tower
feats.description: Visit the Kingdom Centre Tower, an iconic skyscraper with an observation deck offering panoramic views of the city.

feats.title: Diriyah
feats.description: Explore Diriyah, a UNESCO-listed site with historic mud-brick architecture and the birthplace of the Saudi state.

feats.title: Al-Masmak Fortress
feats.description: Learn about Saudi Arabia's history at Al-Masmak Fortress, a museum showcasing artifacts and exhibits.

feats.title: Al-Dirah Souq
feats.description: Shop for traditional goods and souvenirs at Al-Dirah Souq, a bustling market with a wide range of products.

feats.title: Edge of the World
feats.description: Embark on a day trip to the Edge of the World, a stunning geological formation on the outskirts of Riyadh.

faq.title: Best time to visit
faq.description: The best time to visit Riyadh is during the cooler months from November to March.

faq.title: Language
faq.description: Arabic is the official language, and English is commonly used in business and hospitality sectors.

faq.title: Currency
faq.description: The currency used in Saudi Arabia is the Saudi Riyal (SAR).

faq.title: Transportation
faq.description: Riyadh has a growing public transportation system, including buses and ride-hailing services.

faq.title: Local Cuisine
faq.description: Try traditional Saudi Arabian dishes such as kabsa, mutabbaq, and dates.

title: Marrakech, Morocco
description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant colors, spices, and culture of Marrakech, a city with a mix of ancient and modern charm.

feats.title: Jemaa el-Fnaa
feats.description: Experience the lively atmosphere of Jemaa el-Fnaa square, where street performers, food stalls, and market vendors come together.

feats.title: Majorelle Garden
feats.description: Stroll through the serene Majorelle Garden, a beautiful oasis with exotic plants and cobalt-blue buildings.

feats.title: Bahia Palace
feats.description: Explore the stunning Bahia Palace, a grand 19th-century residence showcasing intricate Islamic architecture.

feats.title: Medina Souks
feats.description: Get lost in the maze-like streets of the Medina and bargain for souvenirs, textiles, and local crafts.

feats.title: Atlas Mountains
feats.description: Take a day trip to the nearby Atlas Mountains to enjoy breathtaking views and nature hikes.

faq.title: Best time to visit
faq.description: The best time to visit Marrakech is during spring (March to May) and autumn (September to November) for pleasant weather.

faq.title: Language
faq.description: Arabic is the official language, but French is also widely spoken, especially in tourist areas.

faq.title: Currency
faq.description: The currency used in Morocco is the Moroccan Dirham (MAD).

faq.title: Transportation
faq.description: Marrakech has a network of taxis, buses, and horse-drawn carriages (calèches) for getting around.

faq.title: Local Cuisine
faq.description: Taste delicious Moroccan dishes such as tagine, couscous, and mint tea.

title: Beirut, Lebanon
description: Discover the captivating city of Beirut, known for its mix of historical sites, modern architecture, and vibrant nightlife.

feats.title: National Museum of Beirut
feats.description: Explore the National Museum of Beirut, home to a vast collection of artifacts from Lebanon's ancient and recent history.

feats.title: Pigeon Rocks
feats.description: Admire the natural rock formations of Pigeon Rocks (Raouché) rising from the sea along Beirut's coastline.

feats.title: Downtown Beirut
feats.description: Stroll through Downtown Beirut, a modern district with stylish boutiques, cafes, and cultural attractions.

feats.title: Jeita Grotto
feats.description: Take a day trip to Jeita Grotto, a magnificent cave system with stunning stalactites and stalagmites.

feats.title: Byblos
feats.description: Visit the ancient city of Byblos, one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.

faq.title: Best time to visit
faq.description: The best time to visit Beirut is during spring (March to May) and autumn (September to November) for mild weather.

faq.title: Language
faq.description: Arabic is the official language, and many people also speak English and French.

faq.title: Currency
faq.description: The currency used in Lebanon is the Lebanese Pound (LBP).

faq.title: Transportation
faq.description: Beirut has taxis, buses, and shared vans (service) as primary modes of transportation.

faq.title: Safety
faq.description: Beirut is generally safe for tourists, but it's advisable to stay informed about local situations.

title: Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description: Explore the sophisticated city of Abu Dhabi, the capital of the UAE, with its futuristic architecture and cultural landmarks.

feats.title: Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque
feats.description: Visit the magnificent Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque, one of the largest mosques in the world.

feats.title: Louvre Abu Dhabi
feats.description: Discover the remarkable Louvre Abu Dhabi, an art and civilization museum that showcases global heritage.

feats.title: Emirates Palace
feats.description: Experience luxury at the Emirates Palace, a grand hotel with opulent interiors and a private beach.

feats.title: Ferrari World
feats.description: Have a thrilling time at Ferrari World, an indoor amusement park featuring high-speed rides and attractions.

feats.title: Corniche Beach
feats.description: Relax and unwind at Corniche Beach, a picturesque waterfront promenade with sandy beaches.

faq.title: Best time to visit
faq.description: The best time to visit Abu Dhabi is during the cooler months from November to April.

faq.title: Language
faq.description: Arabic is the official language, but English is widely spoken, especially in the hospitality industry.

faq.title: Currency
faq.description: The currency used in Abu Dhabi is the UAE Dirham (AED).

faq.title: Transportation
faq.description: Abu Dhabi has an efficient public transportation system, including buses and taxis.

faq.title: Local Cuisine
faq.description: Enjoy a mix of Arabic and international cuisines at Abu Dhabi's diverse restaurants.

title: Amman, Jordan
description: Explore the historic city of Amman, Jordan's capital, with its ancient ruins, vibrant markets, and hilltop citadels.

feats.title: Roman Theatre
feats.description: Visit the well-preserved Roman Theatre, a 2nd-century amphitheater still used for events today.

feats.title: Amman Citadel
feats.description: Discover the Amman Citadel, a historic site with ancient ruins and panoramic views of the city.

feats.title: Rainbow Street
feats.description: Wander along Rainbow Street, known for its cafes, art galleries, and lively atmosphere.

feats.title: Souk Jara
feats.description: Experience Souk Jara, an open-air market where local artisans sell crafts, clothing, and delicious food.

feats.title: Dead Sea
feats.description: Take a day trip to the Dead Sea, the lowest point on Earth, and float effortlessly in its salty waters.

faq.title: Best time to visit
faq.description: The best time to visit Amman is during spring (March to May) and autumn (September to November) for mild weather.

faq.title: Language
faq.description: Arabic is the official language, but English is widely understood, especially in tourist areas.

faq.title: Currency
faq.description: The currency used in Jordan is the Jordanian Dinar (JOD).

faq.title: Transportation
faq.description: Amman has taxis and buses for local transportation, and it serves as a hub for travel within Jordan.

faq.title: Local Cuisine
faq.description: Savor delicious Jordanian dishes such as mansaf, falafel, and knafeh.

description: Discover the modern capital of Saudi Arabia, Riyadh, with its towering skyscrapers, traditional souks, and cultural attractions.

feats.title: Kingdom Centre Tower
feats.description: Visit the Kingdom Centre Tower, an iconic skyscraper with an observation deck offering panoramic views of the city.

feats.title: Diriyah

feats.title: Al-Masmak Fortress
feats.description: Learn about Saudi Arabia's history at Al-Masmak Fortress, a museum showcasing artifacts and exhibits.

feats.title: Al-Dirah Souq
feats.description: Shop for traditional goods and souvenirs at Al-Dirah Souq, a bustling market with a wide range of products.

feats.title: Edge of the World
